idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States Populated Place Areas is a polygon theme representing populated place areas such as census designated places, consolidated cities, and incorporated places within United States identified by the U.S. Census Bureau. Attribute information includes the name, class, population classification, population density, number of housing units and size of the areas.
descript.purpose: United States Populated Place Areas provides areal locations for populated places including attributesâ€”name, FIPS code, census class, area, and selected demographic data from the U.S. Census.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.

citeinfo.title: United States Populated Place Areas, 2012
citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau, Esri

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent concentrations of population within the United States that include both incorporated places and census designated places identified by the U.S. Census Bureau.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The class of the populated place.

edom.edomvd: In Connecticut, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania, an incorporated place.
Census designated place - A statistical area defined for a named concentration of population and the statistical counterpart of an incorporated place.
An incorporated place in all states (not Hawaii) and the District of Columbia.

The portion of a consolidated city (a unit of local government for which the functions of an incorporated place and its county or minor civil division (MCD) have merged) not included in another separately incorporated place.
A type of incorporated place in Alaska.
A type of incorporated place in Pennsylvania and Alaska.
An incorporated place in 30 States. In some states, the Census Bureau treats these towns as the equivalent of a minor civil division.
An incorporated place in 19 States. The Census Bureau treats villages in some states as county subdivisions.
The populated place class is unknown.

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the populated place is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the populated place is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology
attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (five-digit number) for the populated place within a state.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 2010 housing unit counts of the populated place.
The 2010 population of the populated place.
The code for the 2010 population class of the populated place.
The 2010 population of the populated place per square mile.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, Census Bureau; Esri

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The area of the populated place in square miles using Albers Equal Area Projection.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
citeinfo.title: 2010 Census TIGER/Line Shapefiles, 2012

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

srcinfo.srccitea: TomTom MultiNet North America Administrative Areas v. 2011.12 and v. 2010.03

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF 1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF 1) data is based on the 2010 Census of Population and Housing.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Started with the Places data set from 2010 Census TIGER/Line Shapefiles. Projected the data set to World Geodetic System of 1984 (WGS 1984). Clipped to the coastline with Data & Maps 2012 U.S. States. Added field CLASS and calculated its values from values removed from the NAME field. Attached and formatted the fields from 2010 Census Summary File 1 and Esri Data. Added field POP_CLASS and calculated its population ranges based on POP2010. Added field SQMI and calculated its values projected to Albers Equal Area. Added and calculated POP10_SQMI with new SQMI values. Reordered and renamed the fields. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: TomTom MultiNet North America Administrative Areas v. 2011.12 and v. 2010.03

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy of TIGER/Line varies with the source materials used. In areas where the Census Bureau has not realigned street features as part of MTAIP it meets, at best, the established National Map Accuracy standards (approximately +/-50 meters or 167 feet) where 1:100,000-scale maps from the USGS were the source. The Census Bureau cannot specify the accuracy of feature changes added by its field staff or local updates or of features derived from the GBF/DIME-Files or other sources. Thus, the level of positional accuracy in the TIGER/Line shapefiles may not be suitable for high-precision measurement applications such as engineering problems, property transfers, or other uses that might require highly accurate measurements of the earth's surface.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
